name: Grammy Patches
description:
RBQ #81
Small       40" x 60"
Large       60" x 80"

Who doesn't have a jelly roll or five laying around? (Alright, I may have a few more than some of you, but they multiply, I swear!) By using just one or two jelly rolls can get you this amazingly simple quilt in a short time with simple construction. Pairing contrasting strips gets you the basis for the rectangular blocks that give so much movement to this quilt. 

By pairing a solid jelly roll with a print jelly roll will give you a completely different look. Speaking of which, the larger size rotates the blocks 90 degrees making it look different than it's smaller counterpart shown.

name: Alphabet Stitchery: Outer Space
description:
RBQ #75
40" x 48"

Blast off into Outer Space! There are many wonderful things to see while you journey with the astronaut and alien and their space ships. You'll see the stars and moon as well as planets and a comet! Included in the pattern are full size designs for each stitchery as well as the pattern for each of the sampler blocks to complete this charming quilt. You may even decide to use applique instead of embroidery!

name: Alphabet Stitchery: Dinosaurs
description:
RBQ #74
40" x 48"

Journey back in time to land land of the dinosaurs. There's many new friends you'll meet along the way, just watch out for the T-Rex! Included in the pattern are full size designs for each stitchery as well as the pattern for each of the sampler blocks to complete this charming quilt. You may even decide to use applique instead of embroidery!

name: MY BOOK - Seamingly Scrappy
description:
Get the Look You Love with Fat Quarters and Precuts

Get your own AUTOGRAPHED COPY of my new book released in mid February 2013. Purchase a copy now! Here's a bit more about the book:

Popular blogger and designer Rebecca Silbaugh presents a wonderfully varied collection of scrappy quilts, all made the easy way. There's something fun for everyone--from beginners to experts--in this value-packed book.

•Choose from 10 innovative quilt patterns and learn the secrets of the Seamingly Scrappy technique

•Save yourself time and energy by using fat quarters, fat eighths, 2 1/2" strips, and 5" and 10" squares

•Select reproduction prints for a traditional feel or use modern fabrics to bring out the playful aspects of these designs

name: Sonesta
description:
RBQ #78
Small       56" x 80"
Medium    68" x 92"
Large       80" x 104"

So I took a little trip to the Caribbean and got a bit brainwashed by all of the sights. When I returned home I looked at the batik wall at my LQS and saw all the colors from the places I had been and decided to make this quilt! However if you look through the photos I also made a flannel version which toned down the pattern quite a bit. I just love how they are both the same pattern and quilting design, yet look completely different!

This quilt is super simple to make using just Fat Quarters for the center. The blocks finish at a large size which also makes construction of this quilt super fast. There are three different sizes included in the pattern. This quilt works well with any colors or style making it great for guys or teens, plus it's scrappy looking! What could be better?!

name: Prima
description:
RBQ #01
94" x 94"

This is the quilt that started it all. This (I am proud to say) is the first quilt I ever designed! Prima looks complex, but it's not. The piecing is so simple, this quilt is great for beginners. 

Even though the quilt is square, the edges are irregular because every star finished complete. Each star fits into place like a puzzle between the other stars, but does not share any of it's points. Choose a border fabric for inspiration and build the quilt center from there!

name: Alphabet Stitchery: Sea Creatures
description:
RBQ #71
40" x 48"

Take a dive into the deep deep sea! There will be many creatures you will see on your journey from the crab and starfish you may see on the beach to the shark and whale you will encounter in the deepest depths. Included in the pattern are full size designs for each stitchery as well as the pattern for each of the sampler blocks to complete this charming quilt. You may even decide to use applique instead of embroidery!

name: Alphabet Stitchery: Bundle of Joy
description:
RBQ #55
40" x 48"

Celebrate the new bundle of joy in your life with a quilt just suited for them! The stitchery designs are filled with necessities for a little one including a rattle, a pacifier, a bottle and many more things. Included in the pattern are full size designs for each stitchery as well as the pattern for each of the sampler blocks to complete this charming quilt. You may even decide to use applique instead of embroidery!

name: General Jack
description:
44" x 44"
RBQ #49

This quilt is a scrappy mix of stars galore! Designed to use Fat Eighths, it also works well with Fat Quarters or as a Stash Buster! It looks much more complex than it really is, it just uses squares and half square triangles. Which fabrics will you make yours out of?

name: Alphabet Stitchery: Jungle Animals
description:
RBQ #30
40" x 48"

Bring some wild animals into your home that won't eat your furniture or tear your house apart (anyone else flashing back to Jumanji?) These animals are perched from high in the trees like the monkey and parrot all the way down to the water like the crocodile and hippo. Included in the pattern are full size designs for each stitchery as well as the pattern for each of the sampler blocks to complete this charming quilt. You may even decide to use applique instead of embroidery!

name: Alphabet Stitchery: Bugs Bugs Bugs
description:
RBQ #54
40" x 48" (without borders)

Bugs Bugs Bugs! These crawlies are cute, not creepy which makes them perfect for the little one in your life that always seems to be bringing home something (or someone) extra in their pocket... There's lady bugs, a snail, a spider, a lightning bug and many more! Included in the pattern are full size designs for each stitchery as well as the pattern for each of the sampler blocks to complete this charming quilt. You may even decide to use applique instead of embroidery!

name: Alphabet Stitchery: Farm Animals
description:
RBQ #29
40" x 48"

Old McDonald had a farm... E I E I O... Wrong song, right theme! Come over for a visit to the farm to see all that is in store. There's the barn, the mischievous goat, a horse, a cow, some chickens, and many more. Included in the pattern are full size designs for each stitchery as well as the pattern for each of the sampler blocks to complete this charming quilt. You may even decide to use applique instead of embroidery!﻿

name: Alphabet Stitchery: Noah's Ark
description:
RBQ #31
40" x 48"

Take a trip aboard the Ark with Noah and several animals - all two by two! Noah brought several animals with him including elephants, camels, pandas, giraffes and more! Included in the pattern are full size designs for each stitchery as well as the pattern for each of the sampler blocks to complete this charming quilt. You may even decide to use applique instead of embroidery!

name: Sciuridae (Cy-ar-day)
description:
RBQ #53
34" x 40"

I love big quilts, but I also love a small project. Sciuridae was drafted when I wanted a wall hanging for my sewing room. Included in the pattern are instructions for an optional coordinating pillow with some of the leftover Flying Geese. This quilt is the perfect size for either a wall hanging, table topper, or crib quilt and would look lovely in any style of fabric.

name: Charmed Living Tote
description:
15"x x 14"h x 3"d -or- 18"w x 18"h x 6"d
RBQ #47

A spin-off of my most popular pattern, the Charmed Living Runner, I'd like to introduce the Charmed Living Tote! There are two size options for this bag using either 1 or 2 Charm Packs, large pockets on the inside and plenty of room to fit all sorts of things. The smaller bag is a perfect day-to-day bag while the larger one would be great for the kid's toys or to take to the beach! This bag could easily do double-duty if made with coated fabrics in the lining so all those wet clothes and sand stay in the bag without getting all over the car...

name: Charmed Living Casaba
description:
36" x 44"
RBQ #52

A twist on the traditional melon block, this quilt has a bigger portion of the melon than usually seen. With just two Charm Packs for the center and pieced border, a little yardage will finish off the supply list for this wall hanging. This quilt also has an open block for some embroidery or a personalized touch. Made traditional or modern, this quilt will look good in any fabric for all occasions and seasons.

name: Leafy Greens
description:
69" x 84"
RBQ #03

A great quilt for a beginner looking to try a new technique, Leafy Greens is a very traditional block colored in a different way. With only three fabrics, this pattern will become a great showcase for your three favorite colors. This would be a great throw to coordinate with any color combination, style or decor.

name: Candy-Coated Dreams
description:
50" x 66"
RBQ #22

A perfect lap sized quilt that can be "cooked up" with any number of color combinations. To get started choose a small scale focal print and begin the fun by choosing 10 coordinating prints. This quilt would make a perfect gift for your sweet or you can keep it for yourself to snuggle up under and create your own Candy-Coated Dreams. Fat Quarter or 1/4 Yard Cut Friendly Instructions!

name: Charmed Living Runner
description:
18" x 32"
RBQ #39

An intriguing design using scraps from your stash or one Charm Pack. Comprised of a single block that's twisted to create dimension in this design, Charmed Living Runner is a great pattern for anyone looking for something different to make with small amounts of fabric. Optional applique instructions included in the pattern offer another way to embellish the runner and make it your own.

name: Skip to My Lou
description:
68" x 84"
RBQ #34

By choosing one focal fabric to weave itself throughout the quilt and adding six coordinating prints, you will have yourself a fun and whimsical patchwork quilt. Skip to My Lou is a simple pattern perfect for beginners and advanced quilters looking for a project that's not so demanding to accomplish. It also is a perfect showcase for that fabric you bought but had no idea what to make. Also includes full color instructions that will be your guide while making this quilt.

name: From Grammy With Love
description:
48" x 58"
RBQ #04

This is such a darling quilt for the little one in your life. A perfect size to use as they grow, this quilt is Fat Quarter Friendly. Full color instructions will guide beginners to advanced quilters throughout construction of the quilt. Just 10 Fat Quarters or Quarter Yard Cuts and a background fabric give you the beginnings of this patchwork design. Why not make a gift for your loved one to wrap up in?

name: Starbox
description:
68" x 92"
RBQ #02

Starbox is a scrappy quilt with very simple piecing and overall design, it just looks more complex than it really is! 

Choose three dimensions of color whether it is your three favorite colors or lights, mediums and darks of the same color. This quilt was made scrappy but would look outstanding made using just three fabrics. Great for beginners looking to advance their techniques.
